etymology.description: 女(女) (nǚ, "woman") + phonetic: 兆(兆) (zhào, "omen") = woman with an elegant omen -> handsome; elegant
etymology.interpretation: The character 姚(yáo) cleverly combines a reference to femininity through 女(女) (nǚ, "woman") with the phonetic and suggestive element 兆(兆) (zhào, "omen"), suggesting a woman associated with elegance or beauty.

examples.chinese: 他长得十分姚(他長得十分姚)。
她穿着旗袍(她穿著旗袍)，显得尤为姚(顯得尤爲姚)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chuānzhuó qípáo, xiǎnde yóuwéi yáo.
examples.english: She wears a cheongsam and appears particularly elegant.
